title: Cramer Wants You to Buy Wal-Mart on a Pullback, Avoid Micron for Now
text:
Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- Wal-Mart ( WMT - Get Report ) is scheduled to report earnings on Tuesday and the analysts at Baird put together an "excellent" research note, TheStreet's Jim Cramer said on CNBC's "Mad Dash" segment Monday. 
With its lowest valuation in some time and a dividend yield approaching 3%, analysts are finding the stock attractive, explained Cramer, the co-manager of the Action Alerts PLUS portfolio . 
While Cramer doesn't expect management to be so forthcoming, if they would just say the drop in the Chinese currency has now increased the company's purchasing power, the stock could rally. 
Wal-Mart WMT data by YCharts 
However, he expects the stock to make one last dip lower, which would provide investors with an excellent buying opportunity -- especially if the yield nears 3.5%. Wal-Mart should also benefit as gas prices continue to move lower, putting more money in consumers' pockets. 
Turning to Micron ( MU - Get Report ) , Cramer pointed out that analysts are mixed on the stock. Some say more downside exists due to a continued imbalance between supply and demand, while others say the worst is over. 
Must Read: The Bulls Are in Danger of Turning Into Lemmings 
The stock's valuation looks cheap, but that's only predicated on the PC industry improving, Cramer said. 
So while shares of Micron look attractive, he's not ready to pull the trigger just yet. Cheap stocks have a tendency to stay cheap for a while. At the time of publication, Cramer's Action Alerts PLUS had no position in companies mentioned. Check Out Our Best Services for Investors
